body: üëã Hello @YanivO1123, thank you for your interest in YOLOv3 üöÄ! Please visit our ‚≠êÔ∏è [Tutorials](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki#tutorials) to get started, where you can find quickstart guides for simple tasks like [Custom Data Training](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data) all the way to advanced concepts like [Hyperparameter Evolution](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/607). If this is a üêõ Bug Report, please provide screenshots and **minimum viable code to reproduce your issue**, otherwise we can not help you. If this is a custom training ‚ùì Question, please provide as much information as possible, including dataset images, training logs, screenshots, and a public link to online [W&B logging](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data#visualize) if available. For business inquiries or professional support requests please visit https://www.ultralytics.com or email Glenn Jocher at glenn.jocher@ultralytics.com. ## Requirements Python 3.8 or later with all [requirements.txt](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/requirements.txt) dependencies installed, including `torch>=1.7`. To install run: ```bash $ pip install -r requirements.txt ``` ## Environments YOLOv3 may be run in any of the following up-to-date verified environments (with all dependencies including [CUDA](https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda)/[CUDNN](https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn), [Python](https://www.python.org/) and [PyTorch](https://pytorch.org/) preinstalled): - **Google Colab and Kaggle** notebooks with free GPU: - **Google Cloud** Deep Learning VM. See [GCP Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart) - **Amazon** Deep Learning AMI. See [AWS Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/AWS-Quickstart) - **Docker Image**. See [Docker Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Docker-Quickstart) ## Status ![CI CPU testing](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/workflows/CI%20CPU%20testing/badge.svg) If this badge is green, all [YOLOv3 GitHub Actions](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/actions) Continuous Integration (CI) tests are currently passing. CI tests verify correct operation of YOLOv3 training ([train.py](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/train.py)), testing ([test.py](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/test.py)), inference ([detect.py](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/detect.py)) and export ([export.py](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/models/export.py)) on MacOS, Windows, and Ubuntu every 24 hours and on every commit.

@YanivO1123 **any YOLOv3/5 model can be used as a starting point for training any other YOLOv3/5 model, no matter the classes or datasets used for either**. No special action is required, simply training normally following the directions in the Train Custom Data tutorial.

## YOLOv3/5 Tutorials

* [Train Custom Data](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki/Train-Custom-Data)  üöÄ RECOMMENDED
* [Tips for Best Training Results](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki/Tips-for-Best-Training-Results)  ‚òòÔ∏è RECOMMENDED
* [Weights & Biases Logging](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/1289)  üåü NEW
* [Supervisely Ecosystem](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/2518)  üåü NEW
* [Multi-GPU Training](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/475)
* [PyTorch Hub](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/36)  ‚≠ê NEW
* [TorchScript, ONNX, CoreML Export](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/251) üöÄ
* [Test-Time Augmentation (TTA)](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/303)
* [Model Ensembling](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/318)
* [Model Pruning/Sparsity](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/304)
* [Hyperparameter Evolution](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/607)
* [Transfer Learning with Frozen Layers](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/1314)  ‚≠ê NEW
* [TensorRT Deployment](https://github.com/wang-xinyu/tensorrtx)

@glenn-jocher thanks a lot for the quick reply!
We are using the detect file from the repository after training starting with the pretrained weights, and receive as output the last image I listed in the question, with labels "frisbee" and "sports ball" that do not exist in our dataset. Is this simply a result of insufficient training? We expected the model not to contain these class names, based on the specification in the data yaml.
@YanivO1123 if you're using the model you trained then it will only have the classes you trained on.

@glenn-jocher thanks, then there indeed appears to be some problem. Please let me know if you'd like me to report the following as a bug (although it's more likely to be incorrect use by us, I think). This is our exact process:
We call the train this way:
python train.py --batch 1 --epochs 1 --data leaf.yaml --weights yolov3.pt

This is our leaf.yaml (which is the only place were we specify the class number and name):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33690998/120211160-4c106780-c239-11eb-8898-06661cade933.png)

The specified leaf_2012_train.txt files contain the path to the training (/testing/val) images respectively. 

After this finishes, we run the detect, this way:
python detect.py --source ../leaf/images/train --weights yolov3.pt --conf 0.25

It outputs a result image per image in the dataset. On many of them, there are no predications (to be expected, as the training was for 1 epoch only), but on one of them, there are predictions labeled from the coco dataset:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33690998/120212255-6dbe1e80-c23a-11eb-9a8a-8252ab6dad29.png)

Is there something wrong in our usage of the repo? We have attempted to follow the tutorial exactly. Perhaps there is some configuration change that we should have done that I have not listed?

Thanks again!

@YanivO1123 the only bug here is in your workflow. If you want to detect on your trained weights then you should point detect.py to those weights, not the official model.
```
python detect.py --weights YOUR_CUSTOM_WEIGHTS.pt
```
